1.caption: Synchronous communication refers to meetings where all attendees gather at a shared time, either in person or remotely

2.caption: Asynchronous communication means that people can contribute to a shared message thread or digital document whenever their schedule allows, regardless of time zones or the availability of the rest of the team. In this illustration, team members contribute ideas to a message thread over a period of several days.
